title: Carbon Revolution IPO price fixed at $2.60, book covered
text:
Carbon fire wheels company Carbon Revolution is bucking the IPO trend and should actually hit the ASX-boards.

Listed equities investors have taken a shine to Carbon Revolution, which makes carbon fibre wheels that are about 40 per cent lighter than normal wheels. Penny Stephens

The IPO price has been fixed at $2.60 and the book is covered, according to a message sent to prospective listed equities investors by joint lead managers Bell Potter and Evans Dixon on Monday afternoon.

The message, sent at 428pm, said:

The JLMs advise that the Carbon Revolution book is well covered at $2.60 per share

As such the bookbuild will now be conducted at a fixed price of $2.60 per share (representing a market capitalisation of approximately $331 million)
description: Carbon Revolution is bucking the IPO trend and should actually hit the boards.
